p: The rat serum was obtained from the Davidson Laboratory in the Psychology Department of the American University, in accordance with the animal welfare and safety protocol #1604. The rats were anesthetized with isoflurane before they were decapitated. The blood was drained in a 15 mL falcon tube and was allowed to clot for 10–15 min at room temperature. It was then centrifuged at 2000 g for 10 min at room temperature. The serum (supernatant) was subsequently pipetted out to a new tube and stored at −80 °C.
